entries.meaning: (psychology) An element of another person that is unconsciously incorporated into one's psyche.
examples: When introjects are weak (or even absent), an anaclitic personality configuration results, characterized by dependency, insecurity, and feelings of helplessness and emptiness.

verbs.description: introject (third-person singular simple present introjects, present participle introjecting, simple past and past participle introjected)

entries.meaning: (psychology) To unconsciously incorporate into one's psyche.
